author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

```
julia> @time using SoilWater_ToolBox  # for 1.7-beta3, could do with some work to reduce startup time, still ok to register I guess: 
 16.239895 seconds (24.72 M allocations: 1.530 GiB, 5.25% gc time, 0.07% compilation time)
```

I'm not sure what's happening with JuliaRegistrator, but I think it's you @joseph-pollacco who blocked registration. FYI, what you need to do if you do not want block (and I'm not sure if too late or if you need to do an intervention):

[no block]

Hallo PÃ¡ll Haraldsson,

A greeting from New Zealand. Thanks for your time for kindly looking at my first large package **SoilWater_ToolBox** which I hope will be useful to the hydrological community.

### Q1)  When I add the package **SoilWater_ToolBox**  in Julia environment it does not work:

_`ERROR: The following package names could not be resolved:
 * SoilWater_ToolBox (not found in project, manifest or registry)`_
 
So the question is how can I unblock the registration as I did not receive any messages indicating that my package was blocked?

### Q2) Yes indeed it will be great if I can reduce the startup time, or else my colleagues will not believe in the power of Julia!

When I start SoilWater_ToolBox I include all the packages I need for the simulation in the following file:
[https://github.com/manaakiwhenua/SoilWater_ToolBox.jl/blob/master/src/Including.jl](https://github.com/manaakiwhenua/SoilWater_ToolBox.jl/blob/master/src/Including.jl) 

I call the subroutine which include all the packages from:

[https://github.com/manaakiwhenua/SoilWater_ToolBox.jl/blob/master/src/SoilWater_ToolBox.jl](https://github.com/manaakiwhenua/SoilWater_ToolBox.jl/blob/master/src/SoilWater_ToolBox.jl)

I will be ever so delighted if you can provide me some tips how to decrease the starting time?

Thanks for your kindness and dedicated for making Julia such a joy to use,
Joseph
@joseph-pollacco I'm a bit lost: can this be merged?

Dear Giordano,

Many thanks for you help. May I suggest you that you **delete** the New package: SoilWater_ToolBox and I resubmit a fresh package. 

It is to be noted that the SoilWater_ToolBox is a very large package and I had many attempts to get all the 8 all checks

Many thanks for your kind help,
Joseph

> May I suggest you that you delete the New package: SoilWater_ToolBox and I resubmit a fresh package.

That's ok, I'm going to close this pull request and you can submit a new registration whenever you want.  However, please note that if you write a message in a pull request without writing `[noblock]` you're effectively blocking registration.  The best thing you can do is to just not write anything.  If you really want to leave a comment you _**must**_ use `[noblock]` if you don't want to stop registration.

Dear Giordano,

Thanks for your very kind help and dedication and for informing me about the [noblock] I was not aware of this subtility.

Great day,
Joseph
